common_issues.title: Pieces macOS UI and Functionality Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing UI and functionality issues with the Pieces desktop app on macOS, including unresponsive UI elements on smaller screens, mysterious icons appearing in Obsidian, and empty chat windows after restarting Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers. Solutions involve UI fixes, icon identification improvements, and investigation into chat loading issues.

related_issues.title: [Obsidian]
related_issues.text:
[Obsidian]
### Software

Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When resizing the right tray, two mysterious icons appear in upper left and lower right

Occurs in both Copilot and Snippets tabs

Confirmed this only happens when Pieces is active in the right tray, not when other plugins are active in the right tray.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/830457d3-4dfc-44fa-a0dc-3f50ab7ea906


Obsidian version 
1.7.7

System
```
Model Name: MacBook Pro
Model Identifier: MacBookPro18,2
Chip: Apple M1 Max
Total Number of Cores: 10 (8 performance and 2 efficiency)
Memory: 64 GB
System Firmware Version: 10151.101.3
OS Loader Version: 10151.101.3
```






## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (@claire-at-pieces) reported a problem with a video Copilot displaying two icons in the corner.
* @mason-at-pieces identified this as a known issue with icon identification.

**Problem:**

* Video Copilot displayed two icons in the corner.

**Solution:**

* This is a known issue and the icons are expected.

**Outcome:**

* User acknowledged and confirmed resolution. 

**Current Status:**

* Issue resolved.

related_issues.title: Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## GitHub Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Interface bug preventing users with small screens (e.g., 11-inch MacBook Air) from completing onboarding due to a button positioned off-screen.

**Key Points:**

* User reports inability to progress due to inaccessible button.
* User suspects the issue is caused by Pieces not considering smaller screen sizes.
* Similar issue reported in #470.
* Pieces team acknowledges the bug and plans to fix it in the next release.

**Solutions:**

* Implement window resizing functionality during onboarding.

**Current Status:**

* Issue will be fixed in the next Pieces release.
* User requested to provide system display size & resolution for further troubleshooting.

**Outcome:**

* Upcoming release will address the bug and improve accessibility for users with smaller screens.

related_issues.title: Demo Chat are stuck loading
related_issues.text:
Demo Chat are stuck loading
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I set up a demo instance of pieces in a VM to test a bug report, for that purpose I skipped the onboarding completely, since then the demo chats are loading:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4c5b430-b6ad-4a90-a256-b410fcae09e5)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041156/log-12062024.txt)
PfD: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041159/log-12062024.txt)

pieces are loaded and annotated correctly:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbba8dfd-5872-4ee4-a9e3-31a9a55f0518)

## GitHub Issue Summary: Empty Chats after pOS and PfD restart

**Key points raised:**

- User hra42 reported empty Chats in Pieces after restarting pOS and PfD.
- Existing issues like "Something went wrong processing", "Pieces Backups not finishing", and "Blank Pieces OS window" might be related.

**Problems identified:**

- After restarting, user's demo conversations were missing from Chats.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- mack-at-pieces from Pieces team will investigate the issue and requested more information about the VM setup.
- Sharing additional  details about VM configuration was suggested to assist with the investigation.

**Current status/outcome:**

- Issue identified and being investigated by Pieces team.
- No solution implemented yet, awaiting further investigation and troubleshooting based on user feedback.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Toolbar Launch Failure
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues launching the Pieces OS toolbar from various sources, including the desktop app, Visual Studio extension, and the OS app itself. This issue appears to be related to an unknown OS error preventing applets from being hosted. The Pieces team is actively investigating the root cause and working on a solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* The OS toolbar is not launching correctly for multiple users, including @Andrea3i.
* This bug was reported after the release of Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.0.
* The issue occurs when trying to launch the toolbar in various ways: from Visual Studio, the desktop app, the OS app itself, and even after restarting the computer.

**Problems Identified:**

* The original issue was assumed to be with the Visual Studio plugin, but further investigation revealed a broader problem.
* The Visual Studio plugin issue was unrelated to the OS toolbar launch failure.
* An unknown OS error is preventing the applets from being hosted.
* The Dart language SDK is preventing the team from identifying the exact OS error.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A hotfix (version 3.0.1) was released for the Visual Studio plugin to resolve a UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 was released with changes to how ports are chosen for webviews.
* @mark-at-pieces offered to debug the issue further with @Andrea3i.
* @robert-at-pieces requested a meeting to run a utility that would reveal the OS error code.
* Potential problems identified: Lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, account permissions, or group policy restrictions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been acknowledged and assigned P0 (critical) priority.
* The team is actively investigating the root cause.
* A scheduled meeting with @Andrea3i will help diagnose the problem further.
* The exact cause and solution are still under investigation.

**Additional Information:**

* Log files are available for analysis.

**Note:** This summary is based on the information provided in the GitHub issue conversation and may not reflect all details.

related_issues.title: Something went wrong with processing
related_issues.text:
Something went wrong with processing
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Any answer gives an error. This problem is the second day.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e237c726-ab1e-4c81-9c2e-706b2aee0675)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @AndreyPLtn reported an issue with unhandled exceptions and processing errors in Pieces OS and Visual Studio extension.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team for follow-up.
* The bot suggested some related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* Unhandled exceptions and processing errors are occurring in Pieces OS and Visual Studio extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The bot suggested checking the related issues for potential solutions.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another ticket and provided a link for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* @AndreyPLtn is directed to the duplicate ticket for further updates and next steps.
* The issue is not resolved yet, but the support team is aware of the problem.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Title:** Files/folders as context not working

**Key Points:**

* User (@omkar-4) reported issues with files/folders as context in Pieces Copilot.
* The issue is difficult to reproduce with existing test cases.
* The support team (@mark-at-pieces) requested the user to share the files/folders causing the problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Files/folders as context are not working as expected.
* The issue is not consistently reproducible.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user was asked to share the problematic files/folders for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not yet responded to the support team's request.
* The issue remains unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The support team provided links to related issues and resources for the user's reference. 
* The support team indicated that they have seen similar issues in the past, making it likely that the user's files/folders are the root cause. 
* The outcome of the issue depends on the user's response and the support team's ability to reproduce the problem with the provided files/folders.

common_issues.title: Pieces Onboarding and Chat Loading Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces onboarding not generating snippets and conversations, and demo chats getting stuck loading. This might be related to incorrect local database handling or skipping onboarding steps. Proposed solutions include investigating VM setup, checking for similar issues, and providing detailed logs for further analysis.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Pieces App Onboarding Bug

**Key Points:**

* @hra42 experienced an issue during onboarding where snippets and conversations were not generated.
* The problem is related to deleting the local database but not the `com.pieces.pfd` folder.
* This leads to a `PERMISSION_DENIED` error when calling the GPT Inference Service.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces identified the bug and confirmed @hra42's setup.
* @mack-at-pieces provided a detailed error message and investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The root cause of the issue is known.
* A solution or workaround is not yet provided in the conversation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests there may be an existing bug with the specific steps mentioned.
* Further investigation and resolution are needed.

common_issues.title: Claude LLM Context Exceeded Error
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing a "Context exceeded" error when using the Claude LLM in Copilot Chats, even with short messages. This issue is a known bug and has been addressed for resolution in an upcoming release scheduled for late December 2024 or early January 2025.

related_issues.title: Message exceeded the context limit for claude LLM Issue
related_issues.text:
Message exceeded the context limit for claude LLM Issue
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/262696c2-c641-4337-9966-abdc4fb18739)
I'm getting this error every time I try to use the Claude LLM. What's the problem?
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Point:** Duplicate of Issue #487. 

**Problem:** Copilot Chats not functioning. 

**Solution:** Fix implemented in upcoming release (late December 2024/early January 2025).

**Current Status:** Issue closed, awaiting release with fix.

related_issues.title: PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
related_issues.text:
PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

On first use of PFD v. 3.2.4 after completing the install wizard, I get a "Context exceeded" error with a short message to copilot in empty chat using (using default model `Claude Sonnet 3.5`) 

Repro 
1. fresh install of PDF on MacOS
2. complete wizard with defaults
3. in chat opened on load, ask default model Claude Sonnet 3.5 "Yo world"

May be related to #487 , but creating separate issue as it relates to onboarding

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/481c3e22-5e84-436d-b81a-4f8bfdc88083

## Conversation Summary:

**Key Points:**

* Claire reported an issue with the Copilot feature.
* Pieces Support Bot provided helpful resources and triaged the issue.
* Mark confirmed it as a duplicate of issue #487.

**Problems Identified:**

* Copilot feature malfunctioning.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Issue will be resolved in the next PiecesOS release.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is marked as a duplicate and will be fixed in the upcoming release.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Error: "Something went wrong with processing."
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported encountering the error message "Something went wrong with processing." when using the Pieces desktop app. The issue appears across different operating systems and Pieces OS versions. Proposed solutions include checking for duplicate issues, reinstalling Pieces OS, and waiting for a fix from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: I'am sorry Something went wrong with processing. please wait a few seconds and try again or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I'am sorry Something went wrong with processing. please wait a few seconds and try again or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

the ChatGpt does not work but with other Gemini works I had faced this before also after trying different solutions  I formatted my laptop by installing new windows, and it worked for 4 days after that, with the same issue please fix this issue. end semester exams are near we need ChatGPT

yes Gemini works but it sucks ChatGPT is best 

 **please fix this issue**

Thank You 
### pieces information
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e95be432-efd0-42e6-b789-2aac6b6dab35)

### The Bug/ issue
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/49aa784e-24b1-46dc-b182-a7d3484ba42b)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User Kiran-Jadhav200 created an issue reporting an error message "Something went wrong with the processing."
* User hra42 commented, suggesting it being a duplicate of #471 and offering a solution (paste link in browser).
* Mark-at-pieces commented and closed the issue as a duplicate.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces app encountered an error message "Something went wrong with the processing."

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Check related issues such as #484, #222, and #483.
* Utilize resources provided (Existing Issues, Documentation, YouTube Channel).
* Access http://localhost:1000/applications when PiecesOS is running and send the result to mark@pieces.app.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was closed as a duplicate of #471.
* User Kiran-Jadhav200 is advised to follow the suggested solution for the duplicate issue.

related_issues.title: Something went wrong with processing
related_issues.text:
Something went wrong with processing
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS 10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Any answer gives an error. This problem is the second day.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e237c726-ab1e-4c81-9c2e-706b2aee0675)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @AndreyPLtn reported an issue with unhandled exceptions and processing errors in Pieces OS and Visual Studio extension.
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team for follow-up.
* The bot suggested some related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* Unhandled exceptions and processing errors are occurring in Pieces OS and Visual Studio extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The bot suggested checking the related issues for potential solutions.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another ticket and provided a link for further investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* @AndreyPLtn is directed to the duplicate ticket for further updates and next steps.
* The issue is not resolved yet, but the support team is aware of the problem.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving the Pieces OS Toolbar Launch Failure:** This issue is impacting users across multiple platforms and functionalities. Investigate the root cause and provide a solution to restore the toolbar's functionality.

**Address the Claude LLM Context Exceeded Error:** This bug is causing frustration for users who are unable to utilize the Claude LLM effectively. Implement the fix in the upcoming release as planned.

**Investigate and resolve onboarding and chat loading issues:** These issues hinder user experience, especially for new users. Ensure smooth onboarding and chat functionality across different setups and operating systems.
**Improve error messaging and guidance for "Something went wrong with processing.":** Provide users with more specific error messages and troubleshooting steps to resolve this common issue.
**Review and update documentation based on common issues and user feedback:** Ensure that the documentation addresses the reported issues and provides clear solutions or workarounds.
**Consider implementing a system for identifying and merging duplicate tickets:** This will help streamline support operations and prevent redundant efforts.

**Gather more detailed logs and system information for troubleshooting:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive logs and system details when reporting issues to facilitate faster diagnosis and resolution.
**Proactively communicate known issues and their estimated resolution timelines:** Keep users informed about ongoing issues and upcoming fixes to manage expectations and reduce support requests.
**Analyze ticket trends to identify areas for product improvement:** Use support data to understand recurring issues and prioritize product enhancements that address user pain points.
